bioghist.p: Esther Aresty (1908-2000) was a culinary historian who wrote on food, cooking and etiquette. Her publications included The Delectable Past (1964), The Best Behavior (1970), and The Exquisite Table (1980), Her large collection of rare cookbooks and manuscripts was donated to the University of Pennsylvania in 1996.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, manuscripts, and printed materials related to or collected by Aresty. Materials include: incoming and some outgoing correspondence related to publishing and civic activities; some personal correspondence; manuscripts for publications, including Delectable Past and Best Behavior; research materials and drafts of articles on etiquette, domestic servants, and Escoffier; copies of Culinary Review; dealer catalogues for cookbooks; printed materials including cookbooks, pamphlets, and newspaper clippings related to food and cooking; newsletters, correspondence and printed materials from the American Institute of Wine and Food; and a small number of recipes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
